text: Just as soon as possible I hurried over to Berkeley. I went straight to
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the bungalow on Dwight Way; I inquired for Miss Holcomb. She was a woman
title: The Blind Spot

text: now in her late twenties, decidedly pretty, a blonde, and of intelligent
title: The Blind Spot

text: bearing.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Looking back over what has just been written, I am sensible of a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot

title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

title: The Blind Spot

author: NA

title: The Blind Spot

text: "In the other world--we call it America--the Jaradas is a Rhamda much
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: like yourself, the head and chief of many Rhamdas sitting in a great
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: institution devoted to intelligence. It is called the University of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: California."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "And this California; what is it, my lord?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "A name," returned Chick. "Immediately on the other side of the Spot is
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a region called California."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The promised land, my lord!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The promised land indeed. There are some who call it paradise, even
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: there." And for good measure he proceeded to tell much of his own land,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of the woods, the rivers, the cities, animals, mountains, the sky, the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: moon, and the sun. When he came to the sun he explained that no man
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: dared to look at it continuously with the bare eyes. Its great heat and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: splendour astounded Geos.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Concerning himself he nonchalantly stated that he was the fiance of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Holcomb's daughter; that is, son-in-law-to-be of the prophet Jarados;
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that he was sort of Junior Rhamda. He declared that he had come from
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the occult Rhamdas, through the other side of the Spot, in search of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Jarados who had gone before. As to his blankness up to now, and his
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: perplexity--he was but a Junior; and the Spot had naturally benumbed his
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: senses. Even now, he apologised, it was difficult to know and to recall
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: everything clearly.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Through it all the Rhamda Geos Listened in something like awe. He
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was hearing of wonders never before guessed in the Thomahlia. As the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: prospective son-in-law of the Jarados, Watson automatically lifted
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: himself to a supreme height, so great that, could he only hold himself
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: up to it, he would have a prestige second only to that of the prophet
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: himself.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: All of a sudden he thought of a question. It gripped him with dread,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the dread of the unknown. The question was one of TIME. "How long have I
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: been here, Rhamda Geos?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Over eleven months, by our system of reckoning. You were found on the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: floor of the temple three hundred and fifty-seven days ago; you were
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: in a lifeless condition; you must have been there some hours, my lord,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: before we discovered you."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Eleven months!" It had seemed but that many minutes. "And I was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: unconscious--"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "All the time, my lord. Had we caught you immediately upon your
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: coming, we could have brought you around within three days, but in the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: circumstances it was impossible to restore you before we did. You have
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: been under the care of the greatest specialists in all Thomahlia."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Geos himself had been one of these. "The council of Rhamdas went into
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: special session, my lord, immediately after your materialisation, and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: has been sitting almost continually since. And now that you are revived,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: they are waiting in person for you to show yourself.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "They accept you. They do not know who you are, my lord; none of us has
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: guessed even a part of the truth. The entire council awaits!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: But Chick wanted more. Besides, he looked at his clothing.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "I would have my own garments, Geos; also, whatever else was found on my
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: person."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: For Watson was thinking of a small but powerful pistol, an automatic,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that he had carried on the night when he fell through the Blind Spot.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: This question of materiality was still a puzzle; if he himself had
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: survived there was a chance that the firearm had done the same. It might
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and it might not preclude the occult. Anyway, he treasured the thought
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of that automatic; with it in his possession he would not be bare-handed
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: in case of emergency.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: They returned to the room in which Chick had awakened. The Rhamda left
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: him. A few moments later he came back with a squad of men. Chick noted
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: their discipline, movement, and uniforms, and classed them as soldiers.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Two men were stationed outside the door--one, a stout, dark individual
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: in a blue uniform; and the other a lithe, athletic chap, blond and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: blue-eyed, wearing a bright crimson dress. Chick instinctively preferred
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: both man and garb in crimson; there was a touch of honour, of lightness
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and strength that just suited him. The other was dark, heavy and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sinister.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Both wore sandals, and upon their heads curious shakos, made of the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: finest down, not fur. Both displayed a heavy silken braid looped from
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: one shoulder. Each carried a spear-like weapon, of some shining black
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: material, straight-tapered to a needle-point; but no other arms.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Watson pointed to the two uniforms.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "What is the significance, Geos?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "One is from the queen, my lord; the other from Bar Senestro. The blue
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: is the cloth of the Bars; the red, that of the queens. The Bar and the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: queen send this bodyguard with their respective compliments."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Chick took the bundle that Geos had brought, and proceeded to don his
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: own clothes, finding deep satisfaction in the fact that they had arrived
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: as intact as he. He felt carefully in his hip pocket; the automatic
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was still there, likewise the extra magazine of cartridges that he had
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: carried about with him on that night.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: In his other pockets he found two packets of cigarettes, a pouch of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: tobacco, some papers, a few coins, a little money and two photographs,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: one of Bertha and the other of her father. Not a thing had been
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: disturbed.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He announced himself ready.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Rhamda conducted him down the corridor, which he found to be lined
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with guards; red on one side, blue on the other. These men fell in
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: behind in two parallel files, one of the one colour and one of the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: other.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: It was a building of great size. The corridors were long and high, all
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with the wide-coved ceiling, and of colours that melted from one shade
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to another as they turned, not corners, but curves. Apparently each
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: colour had its own suggestive reason. Such rooms as Chick could look
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: into were uniformly large, beautiful, and distinctly lighted.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The guard moved in silent rhythm; the chief sound was that made by
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Watson's leather-heeled shoes, drowning out, for once, the everlasting
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: tinkling undertone of those unseen fairy-bells; that running cadence,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: never ceasing, silver, liquid, like the soul of sound.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Though Watson walked with head erect, he had eyes for every little thing
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: he passed. He noted the material of the structure and tried to name it;
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: neither plaster nor stone, the walls were highly polished and, somehow
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: or other, capable of emitting perfume--light and wholesome, not heavy
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and oppressive. And in dark passages the walls glowed.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The corridor widened, and with a graceful curve opened upon a wide
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: stairway that descended, or rather sank--to use Watson's own words
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: for the feeling--into the depths of the building. To the right of one
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: landing was a large window reaching to the floor; its panes were clear
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and not frosted as had been the others.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Chick got his first glimpse here of what lay outside--an iridescent
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: landscape, at first view astonishingly like an ocean of opals; for it
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was of many hues, red and purple and milky white, splashed violantin
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: blue and fluorescence--a maze and shimmer of dancing, joyful colours,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: whirring in an uncertainty of polychromatic harmony. Such was his first
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: fleeting impression.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: At the next landing he looked closer. It was not unlike a monster
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: bowl of bubbles; the same illusion of movement, the same delicacy
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and witchery of colour, only here the sensation was not that of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: decomposition but of life; of flowers, delicate as the rainbow, tenuous,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sinuous, breathing--weaving in a serpentine maze of daedalian hues; long
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: tendrils of orchidian beauty, lifting, weaving, drooping--a vast sea of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: equatorial bloom; but--no trees.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "This is our landscape," spoke the Rhamda. "According to the Jarados, it
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: is not like that of the next world--your world, my lord. After you meet
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Rhamdas, I shall take you into the Mahovisal for a closer view of it
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: all."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: They reached the bottom of the stairway. Chick noted the architecture in
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the entrance-way at this point; the seeming solidness of structure, as
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: if the whole had been chiselled, not built. The vestibule was really
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a hall, domed and high, large enough to shelter a hundred. Like the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: corridor outside Chick's room, it was lined with a row each of red and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: blue uniformed guards.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Invariably the one belonged to the blond, lithe, quick-feeling type,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the others heavy, sturdy, formidable. The extremities of the two lines
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: converged on an oval-topped doorway, very large, having above it a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: design conventionalised from the three-leafed clover. One leaf was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: scarlet, one blue, the other green.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The door opened. The guards halted. Geos stepped aside with a bow, and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Watson strode forward into the presence of the Council of the Rhamdas.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: XXXIV
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: THE BAR SENESTRO
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: It was a critical moment for Chick. Out of the impulse of his inner
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: nature he had chosen the odds that he must now uphold against the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: combined wisdom of these intellectuals. He was alone, with no one
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to guide him save Geos, who undoubtedly was his friend, but who as
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: undoubtedly would desert him upon the slightest inkling of imposture.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He found himself in a great, round room, or rather an oval one, domed at
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the top but tinted in a far more beautiful colouring--lazuli blue. The
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: walls were cut by long, narrow windows reaching far up into the sweep
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: where the side melted into the ceiling. The material of the windows was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of the same translucent substance already noted, but slightly tinged
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with green, so that they shed a soft light, cooled and quiet, over the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: whole assembly.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: On the wall opposite the doorway was a large replica of the clover-leaf
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: design outside, even more gem-like in brilliance; its three colours
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: woven into a trinity almost of flame. Whether the light was artificial
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: or intrinsic, Chick could not say. The floor of the place accommodated
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: some three hundred tables, of the library type, and the same number
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of men bearing the distinguished stamp of the Rhamda. All were
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: smooth-shaven, comparatively tall, and possessing the same aesthetic
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: manner which impressed one with the notion of inherited, inherent
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: culture. The entire hall had the atmosphere of learning, justice and the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: supreme tribunal.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: For a moment Watson felt weak and uncertain. He could hold up against
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Geos and Avec, but in the face of such an array he wasn't so sure. There
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was but one thing to encourage him; the faces into which he looked. All
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: were full of wonder and reverence.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Then he looked about him more carefully. He had come out upon a wide
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: platform, or rostrum. He now noticed that he was flanked on either side
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: by thrones--two of them; they seemed made of golden amber. The one on
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the right was occupied by a man, the other by a woman. In the pause that
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was vouchsafed him Chick took note of these two, and wondered.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: In the first place, the man was not a Rhamda. The jewelled semi-armour
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that he wore was more significant than the dignified garb of the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Intellectuals; at the same time, his accoutrements cheapened him, by
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: contrast. He was executive, princely, with the bearing that comes of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: worldly ambitions and attainments; a man strangely handsome, vital,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: athletic; curling hair, dark, quick eyes and even features; except
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: only for the mouth he might have been taken as a model of the Greek
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Alexander.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The clothes he wore were classic, as was everything else about him, even
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to his sandals, his bare arms and his jewelled breastplate.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Watson had studied history. He had a quick impression of a composite--of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: genius, cruelty and sensuality. Here was one with three strong natures,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a sort of Nero, Caligula and Alexander combined: the sensuality of the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: first, the cruelty of the second, and the instinctive fire and greatness
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of the immortal Macedonian. The man was smiling; not an amused smile,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: but one of interest, humorous tolerance.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: When their eyes met, Chick caught the magnetic current of personality,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the same sense of illusiveness that he and Harry Wendel had noted in
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Nervina; only here it was negative, resisting instead of aiding.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: A number of the blue guard surrounded the throne, their faces dark,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: strong, and of unconquerable resolution, though slow to think.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: On the other throne was a girl. Chick had heard enough from the Geos to
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: guess her identity: one of the queens, the Aradna; frail, delicate, a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: blue-eyed maiden, with a waving mass of straw-gold hair hanging loosely
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: about her shoulders. She too was classically attired, although there
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: were touches of modernity here and there in the arrangement of ribbons;
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the garment matched her guards' crimson, and was draped about her
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: shoulders so as to leave one bare, together with that arm. Across her
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: forehead was a band of dark-blue gems, and she wore no other jewels.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: She was not more than seventeen or eighteen, with eyes like bluebells,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: lips as red as poppies, features that danced with delight and laughter
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and all the innocence that one would associate with elfin royalty.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Instinctively Chick compared her with the Nervina.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The senior queen had the subtle magnetism, the uncountable fascination,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the poise and decision that held and dictated all things to her fancy.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Not so the Aradna. Hers was the strength of simplicity, the frank, open
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: delight of the maiden, and at the same time all the charm and suggestion
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of coming womanhood. When she caught Watson's eye she smiled; a smile
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: free and unrestrained, out of an open, happy heart. She made a remark
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to one of her guards, who nodded a reply after the manner of a friend,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: rather than a courtier.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Watson turned to the Geos, who stood somewhat to one side, and a little
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to the rear.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The Aradna?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Yes. The queen of D'Hartia. The man on the other side is the Bar
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Senestro."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Whatever feeling Chick entertained for the one was offset by what he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: felt for the other. He was between two forces; his instinct warned him
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of the Bar, sceptical, powerful, ruthless, a man to be reckoned with;
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: but his better nature went out to the young queen.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: At a motion from Geos, the whole assembly of Rhamdas stood up. The
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: action was both dignified and reverent. Though Chick was, in their eyes,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a miracle, there was no unseemly staring nor jarring of curiosity; all
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was quietness, ease, poise; the only sound was that of the constant
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: subtle music of those invisible bells.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Rhamda Geos began speaking. At the same time he placed a friendly hand
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: on Watson's shoulder, a signal for every other Rhamda to resume his
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: seat.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The Fact and the Substance, my brothers."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Geos paused as he made use of the ultra-significant phrase. And then,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: in a few rapid sentences, he ran over the synopsis of that affair,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: beginning with some philosophy and other details that Watson could only
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: half understand, making frequent allusions to the Jarados and other
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: writers of prophecy; then he made some mention of his own particular
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: brand of spiritism and its stand on materialisation. This he followed
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with an account of the finding of Watson in the temple, his long sleep
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and ultimate reviving. At greater length he repeated the gist of their
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: conversation.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Not until then was there a stir among the Rhamdas. Chick glanced over at
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Aradna. She was listening eagerly, her chin cupped in her hand,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: her blue eyes full of interest and wonder, and natural, unfeigned,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: child-like delight.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Then the Bar caught Chick's glance; the newcomer felt the cold chill of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: calculation, the cynical weight of the sceptic, and a queer foreboding
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of the future; no light glance, but one like fire and ice and iron.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He wondered at the man's beauty and genius, and at his emotional
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: preponderance manifest even here before the Rhamdas.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Geos went on. His words, now, were simple and direct. Watson felt
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: himself almost deified by that reverent manner. The Rhamdas listened
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with visibly growing interest; the Aradna leaned slightly forward; even
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Bar dropped his interest in Watson to pay closer attention to the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: speaker. For Geos had come to the Jarados; he was an orator as well as
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a mystic, and he was advancing Chick's words with all the skill of a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: master of language, ascending effect--climax--the Jarados had come among
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: them, and--They had missed him!
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: For a moment there was silence, then a rustle of general comment. Chick
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: watched the Rhamdas, leaning over to whisper to each other. Could he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: stand up against them?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: But none of them spoke. After the first murmur of comment they lapsed
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: into silence again. It was the Bar Senestro who broke the tension.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "May I ask, Rhamda Geos, why you make such an assertion? What proof have
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: you, to begin with, that this man," indicating Watson with a nod, "is
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: not merely one of ourselves: a D'Hartian or a Kospian?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Geos replied instantly: "You know the manner of his discovery, Bar
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Senestro. Have you not eyes?" Geos seemed to think he had said the last
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: word.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Surely," rejoined the Bar good-humouredly. "I have very good eyes,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Rhamda Geos. Likewise I have a mind to reason with; but my imagination,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: I fear, is defective. What I behold is just such a creature as myself;
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: not otherwise. How hold you that this one is proof out of the occult?"

text: XXXIX
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: WHO IS THE JARADOS?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: It was all over. Chick opened his eyes to see the Jan throwing open the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: plate on the side of the compartment. Neither the soldier nor the Rhamda
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: seemed to have noted Chick's daze. As for the Jan, his blue eyes were
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: dancing with dare-devilry.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "That's what I call living!" he grinned. "They can keep on looking for
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the June Bug all night!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Chick looked out. They were inside the great room from which they had
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: started; the trip was over; the plunge had been made in safety. Chick
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: took a long breath, and held out a hand.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "A man after my own heart, Jan Lucar. I foresee that we may have great
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sport with the Senestro."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Aye, my lord," cheerfully. "The presumptuous usurper! I only wish I
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: could kill him, instead of you."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "You are not the only one," commented the Rhamda. "Half of the Rhamdas
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: would cheerfully act as the chosen one's proxy."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: And so ended the events of Chick Watson's first day beyond the Blind
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Spot, his first day on the Thomahlia; that is, disregarding the previous
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: months of unconsciousness. He had good reason to pass a sleepless night
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: in legitimate worry for the outcome of it all; but instead he slept the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sound sleep of exhaustion, awakening the next morning much refreshed.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He reminded himself, first of all, that today was the one immediately
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: preceding that of his test--the Day of the Prophet. He had only a little
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: more than twenty-four hours to prepare. What was the best and wisest
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: proceeding?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He called for the Geos. He told him what data he wanted. The Rhamda said
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that he could find everything in a library in that building, and inside
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a half-hour he returned with a pile of manuscripts.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Left to himself, Chick found that he now had data relating to all the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sciences, to religion, to education and political history and the law.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The chronology of the Thomahlians, Chick found, dates back no less than
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: fifteen thousand years. An abiding civilisation of that antiquity, it
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: need not be said, presented somewhat different aspects from what is
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: known on the earth.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: It seemed that the Jarados had come miraculously. That is, he had come
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: out of the unknown, through a channel which he himself later termed the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Spot of Life.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He had taught a religion of enlightenment, embracing intelligence,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: love, virtue, and the higher ethics such as are inherent in all great
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: philosophies. But he did not call himself a religionist. That was the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: queer point. He said that he had come to teach an advanced philosophy of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: life; and he expressly stated that his teachings were absolute only to a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: limited extent.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Man must seek and find," was one of his epigrams; "and if he find no
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: more truths, then he will find lies." Which was merely a negative way of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: saying that some of his philosophy was only provisional.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: But on some points he was adamant. He had arrived at a time when the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: unthinking, self-glorifying Thomahlians had all but exterminated the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: lower orders of creation. The Jarados sought to remove the handicap
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: which the people had set upon themselves, and gave them, in the place
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of kindness which they had forgotten, how to use, a burning desire for
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a positive knowledge, where before had been only blind faith. Also, he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: taught good-fellowship, as a means to this end. He taught beauty, love,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and laughter, the three great cleansers of humanity. And yet, through it
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: all--
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Jarados was a mystic.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: He studied life after a manner of his own. He was a stickler for getting
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: down to the very heart of things, for prodding around among causes until
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: he found the cause itself. And thus he learned the secret of the occult.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: For so he taught. And presently the Jarados was recognized as an
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: authority on what the Thomahlia called "the next world." Only he showed
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that death, instead of being an ushering into a void, was merely a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: translation onto another plane of life, a higher plane and a more
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: glorious one. In short, a thing to be desired and attained, not to be
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: avoided.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: This put the Spot of Life on an entirely different basis. No longer
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was it a fearsome thing. The Jarados elevated death to the plane of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: motherhood--something to glory in. And Chick gathered that his famous
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: prophecy--which he had yet to read, where it hung on the wall of the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: temple--gave every detail of the Jarados' profound convictions and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: teachings regarding the mystery of the next life.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: And now comes a curious thing. As Chick read these details, he became
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: more and more conscious of--what shall it be called?--the presence of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: someone or something beside him, above and all about him, watching his
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: every movement. He could not get away from the feeling, although it was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: broad daylight, and he was seemingly quite alone in the room. Chick was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: not frightened; but he could have sworn that a very real personality was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: enveloping his own as he read.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Every word, somehow, reminded him of the miraculous sequence of facts
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: as he knew them; the unerring accuracy with which he, quite unthinkingly
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and almost without volition, had solved problem after problem, although
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the chances were totally against him. He became more and more convinced
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: that he himself had practically no control over his affairs; that he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: was in the hands of an irresistible Fate; and that--he could not help
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: it--his good angel was none other than the prophet who, almost ninety
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: centuries ago, had lived and taught upon the Thomahlia, and in the end
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: had returned to the unknown.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: But how could such a thing be? Watson did not even know where he was!
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Small wonder that, again and again, he felt the need of assurance. He
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: asked for the Jan Lucar.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "In the first place," began Chick without preamble, "you accept me, Jan
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Lucar; do you not?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Absolutely, my lord."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "You conceive me to be out of the spiritual world, and yet flesh and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: blood like yourself?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Of course," with flat conviction.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: That settled it. Watson decided to find out something he had not had
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: time to locate in the library.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The Rhamda may have told you, Jan Lucar, that I am here to seek the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Jarados. Now, I suspect the Senestro. Can you imagine what he has done
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to the prophet?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "My lord," remonstrated the other, "daring as the Bar might be, he could
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: do nothing to the Jarados. He would not dare."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Then he is afraid to run counter to the prophecy?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Yes, my lord; that is, its literal interpretation. He is opposed only
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: to the broader version as held by such liberals as the Rhamda Avec. The
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Bars are always warning the people against the false one."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "And the Senestro is at their head," mused Chick aloud. "This brother of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: his who died--usually there are two such princes and chiefs?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Yes, my lord."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "And the Senestro plans to marry both queens, according to the custom!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "My lord"--and the Jan suddenly snapped erect--"the Bar will do
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: exceedingly well if he succeeds in marrying one of them! Certainly he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: shall never have the Aradna--not while I live and can fight!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Good! How about the Nervina?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "He'll do well to find her first!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "True enough. What would you say was his code of honour?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "My lord, the Senestro actually has no code. He believes in nothing. He
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: is so constituted, mentally and morally, that he cares for and trusts in
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: none but himself. He is a sceptic pure and simple; he cares nothing for
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Jarados and his teachings. He is an opportunist seeking for power,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: wicked, lustful, cruel--"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "But a good sportsman!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "In what way, my lord?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Didn't he allow me the choice of combat?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Jan laughed, but his handsome face could not hide his contempt.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "It is ever so with a champion, my lord. He has never been defeated in
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a matter of physical prowess. It would be far more to his glory to
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: overcome you in combat of your own selection. It will be spectacular--he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: knows the value of dramatic climax--and he would kill you in a moment,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: before a million Thomahlians."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "It's a nice way to die," said Watson. "You must grant that much."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "I don't know of any nice way to die, my lord. But it is a good way of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: living--to kill the Bar Senestro. I would that I could have the honour."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "How does it come that the Rhamdas, superintellectual as they are,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: can consent to such a contest? Is it not degrading, to their way of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: thinking? It smacks of barbarism."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "They do not look upon it in that light, my lord. Our civilisation has
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: passed beyond snobbery. Of course there was a time, centuries ago when
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: we were taught that any physical contest was brutal. But that was before
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: we knew better."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "You don't believe it now?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "By no means, my lord. The most wonderful physical thing in the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Thomahlia is the human body. We do not hide it. We admire beauty,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: strength, prowess. The live body is above all art; it is the work of God
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: himself; art is but an imitation. And there is nothing so splendid as
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: a physical contest--the lightning correlation of mind and body. It is a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: picture of life."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Do the Rhamdas think this?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Most assuredly. A Rhamda is always first an athlete."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Why?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Perfection, my lord. A perfect mind does not always dwell in a perfect
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: body, but they strive for it as much as possible. The first test of a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Rhamda is his body. After he passes that he must take the mental test."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Mental?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Moral first. The most rigid, perhaps of all; he must be a man above
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: suspicion. The honour of a Rhamda must never be questioned. He must
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: be upright and absolutely unselfish. He must be broad-minded,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: human, lovable, and a leader of men. After that, my lord, comes the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: intellectual test."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "He must be a learned man?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Not exactly, your lordship. There are many very learned men who could
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: not be Rhamdas; and there are many who have had no learning at all
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: who eventually were admitted. The qualifications are intellectual,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: not educational; the mind is put to a rigid test. It is examined for
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: alertness, perception, memory, reason, emotion, and control. There is no
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: greater honour in all the Thomahlia."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "And they are all athletes?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Every one, my lord. In all the world there is no finer body of men, I
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: myself would hesitate before entering a match with even the old Rhamda
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Geos."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "How about the Rhamda Avec?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Nor he, either; in the gymnasium he was always the superior, just as he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: topped all others morally and mentally."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Did this explain the Avec's physical prowess, on the one hand, and the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: fact that he would not stoop to take that ring by force, on the other?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Just one more thing, Jan Lucar. You have absolutely no fear that I may
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: fail tomorrow?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Not the slightest, my lord. You cannot fail!"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Why not?"
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "I have already said--because you are from the Jarados."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: And Chick, facing the greatest experience of his life, submerged in a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: sea wherein only a few islands of fact were visible, had to be content
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: with this: his only friends were those who were firmly convinced of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: something which, he knew only too well, was a flat fraud! All this
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: backing was based upon a misled faith.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: No, not quite. Was there not that strange feeling that the Jarados
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: himself was at his back? And had he not found that the prophet had
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: been real? Did he not feel, as positively as he felt anything, that the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Jarados was still a reality?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: THE TEMPLE OF THE BELL
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: It was hard for Chick to remember all the details of that great day.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Throughout all the morning and afternoon he remained in his apartments.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Breakfast over, the Rhamdas told him his part in certain ceremonies,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: such as need not be detailed here. They were very solicitous as to
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: his food and comfort, and as to his feelings and anticipations. His
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: nonchalance pleased them greatly. Afterward he had a bath and rub-down.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: A combat to the death, was it to be? Suits me, thought Watson. He was
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: never in finer form.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The Jan Lucar was particularly interested. He pinched and stroked
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Chick's muscles with the caressing pride of a connoisseur. Watson
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: stepped out of the fountain bath in all the vigour of health. He
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: playfully reached out for the Lucar and tripped him up. He sought to
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: learn just what the Thomahlians knew in the art of self-defence.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: The brief struggle that ensued taught him that he need expect no easy
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: conquest. The Jan was quick, active and the possessor of a science

title: The Blind Spot

text: Again refraining from any comment we pass on to the more exhaustive
title: The Blind Spot

text: opinion of Sir Henry Hodges. Inasmuch as this seems to coincide very
title: The Blind Spot

text: closely with the hypothesis of Professor Holcomb, and as the reputation
title: The Blind Spot

text: of Sir Henry is a thing of weight, we are quoting him almost verbatim:
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "There is a well-known experiment in chemistry, wherein equal quantities
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of water and alcohol are mixed. Let us say, a pint of each. Now, the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: resulting mixture ought to be a quart; but it is not. It is somewhat
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: less than a quart.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Strange, indeed, to the novice, but a commonplace to every student of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the subject. It is strange only that, except for Dr. Holcomb and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: this man Avec, science has overlooked the stupendous significance and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: suggestion of this particular fact.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Now, consider another well-known fact: No matter how you try you cannot
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: prevent gravity from acting. It will pull every object down, regardless
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: of how you try to screen it from the earth.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Why? Because gravity penetrates all things. Again, why? Why should
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: gravity penetrate all things?
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "The answer is, because gravity is a function of the ether. And the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: ether is an imponderable substance, so impalpable that it passes right
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: through all solids as though they were not there.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "These are two highly suggestive points. They show us, first, that two
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: substances can exist within the space formerly thought to be completely
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: filled by one. Second, they show that ALL substances are porous to the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: ether.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Very well. Bear in mind that we know nothing whatever directly about
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the ether; our knowledge is all indirect. Therefore--
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "It may be that there is more than one ether!
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Conceive what this means. If there were another ether, how could we
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: become aware of it? Only through the medium of some such phenomenon as
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: the Blind Spot; not through ordinary channels. For the ordinary channels
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: are microscopes and test-tubes, every one of which, when traced to the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: ultimate, is simply a concrete expression of THE ONE ETHER WE KNOW!
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "In the nature of the case our five senses could never apprehend a
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: second ether.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Yet, knowing what we do about the structure of the atom, of electronic
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: activity, of quantels, we must admit that there is a huge, unoccupied
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: space--that is, we can't see that it is occupied--in and between the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: interstices of the atom.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "It is in the region, mingled and intertwined with the electrons which
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: make up the world we know so well, that--in my opinion--the Thomahlian
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: world exists. It is actually coexistent with our own. It is here, and
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: so are we. At this very instant, at any given spot, there can be,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: and almost certainly is, more than one solid object--two systems of
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: materiality, two systems of life, two systems of death. And if two, why,
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: then, perhaps there are even more!
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "Holcomb is right. We are Infinity. Only our five senses make us
title: The Blind Spot

text: finite."
title: The Blind Spot

text: Charlotte Fenton does not indulge in speculation. She seems to bear up
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: wonderfully well in the face of Harry Wendel's affinity for the
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Nervina, and also in the face of her brother's disappearance. And she
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: philosophically states:
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "When Columbus returned from his search for the East Indies, he
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: triumphantly announced that he had found what he sought.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "He was mistaken. He had found something else--America.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "It may be that we are all mistaken. It may be that something entirely
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: different from what any one has suspected has been found. Time will
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: tell. I am willing to wait."
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: To make it complete, it is felt that the following statement of General
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: Hume is not only essential, but convincing to the last degree.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "My view regarding this mystery is simply this: I have eyes, and I
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: have seen. I don't know whether the actors were living or dead. I am
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: no scientist; I have no theory. I only know. And I will swear to what I
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: saw.
title: The Blind Spot
author: NA

text: "I am a soldier. The two men who are bringing this to press have shown
title: The Blind Spot

text: me their copy.

text: "It is correct."
